abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Third Small and
            Medium Industries Project for Sri Lanka was satisfactory.
            The project achieved its objectives, its impact on
            institutional development was only partially successful,
            sustainability is uncertain at this time, and the
            performance of both the Bank and Borrower was satisfactory.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First, for
            more systematic and effective project monitoring, the role
            of the Apex Institution needs to be redefined and its
            capabilities further improved to be able to carry out an
            in-depth evaluation of economic impact and financial
            performance of SMI sub-projects. Second, to ensure the
            sustainability of SMI sector lending, the financial sector
            needs to adopt lending to SMIs as part of their long-term
            strategy. Third, more attention must be given to the design
            and implementation of the TA component and to developing an
            effective monitoring system to ensure more efficient and
            successful project implementation. Finally, steps should be
            taken to improve the effectiveness of experts through a
            better selection process, evaluation of their performance,
            and establishing counterparts in the concerned institution.
